summary: Amazon has witnessed a nearly threefold rise in valuation over the last few years . Amazon continues to invest in various areas of AI that can help accelerate revenue growth and profit margin expansion . While Amazon stock has recovered from a notable dip last month, it still looks like an attractive buy for long-term investors .  Hedge fund manager Bill Ackman initiated a stake in Amazon through his investment firm, Pershing Square Capital Management . The most obvious area of Amazon's ecosystem that has benefited from the AI boom so far is the company's cloud computing segment, Amazon Web Services .  Amazon is testing various forms of AI robotics in its fulfillment centers . Amazon is also developing its own custom chipsets -- dubbedTrainiumand Inferentia . Amazon's stock has declined by roughly 1% on the year .  Pershing Square's Amazon position was not included in the fund's 13F filing for the first quarter . Amazon's valuation has risen considerably more than those of bothMicrosoftandAlphabet . This is significant because both companies compete fiercely with Amazon in the cloud computing market .  Amazon has a strong foundation to continueaccelerating revenue and profit growth for the long run . Nvidia has been the best Magnificent Seven investment throughout the AI revolution thus far . Amazon's current trajectory supports the idea that the company could see a more than twofold rise in market cap .  The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years . Sister to Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors . Adam Spatacco has a position in Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia .

OpenAI and Microsoft may be reaching an inflection point in their relationship . The two companies are in a standoff over OpenAI’s $3 billion acquisition of the AI coding startup, Windsurf . OpenAI executives have considered publicly accusing Microsoft of anticompetitive behavior .  OpenAI has reportedly tried to reduce its reliance on Microsoft for cloud services in recent months . OpenAI is reportedly trying to reduce reliance on cloud services .

Microsoft has too many strengths, from AI to cloud computing, and a wide moat . Coca-Cola's brand name grants it a significant advantage . Both market leaders have robust businesses and impeccable dividend programs .  Microsoft's cloud unit recorded revenue growth of 33% for the period . The tech leader's total revenue increased by a far more modest (but still strong) 13% year over year to $70.1 billion . Azure is second only toAmazonWeb Services in this industry and has been gaining ground .  Microsoft combines growth and dividends . It has the highest credit rating available from S&P Global, higher than that of the U.S. government . The tech giant has raised its payouts by 167.7% in the past 10 years .  Coca-Cola markets its products in most countries, but it does most of the manufacturing for each region locally . There won't be a significant impact of tariffs on its financial results . The company also has important strengths that make it a top long-term pick .  Coca-Cola isn't the most exciting stock on the market, but the most reliable . Strong brands give it the flexibility to adjust its product portfolio according to changing tastes and preferences . It has raised its payouts for 63 consecutive years, making it a Dividend King .
